choices.D: Each pair of peers has a private set of IPsec security associations that is only shared between the two peers
choices.C: Security associations do not need to linger between members once a group member has authenticated to the key server and obtained the group policy
choices.A: GDOI IKE sessions are established between all peers in the network

questions.question_text: When implementing GET VPN, which of these is a characteristic of GDOI IKE?

choices.D: the set connection command with the embryonic-conn-max option

discussion.content:
For IOS it’s B.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/sec_data_dos_atprvn/configuration/15-mt/sec-data-dos-atprvn-15-mt-book/sec-cfg-tcp-intercpt.html#GUID-5B97F0E8-E5BE-4982-9CCC-B5736F8FA5E4

For ASA it’s D.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa82/configuration/guide/config/conns_connlimits.html#wp1080734

questions.question_text: Which Cisco ASA configuration is used to configure the TCP intercept feature?

choices.C: Device Management > Users/AAA > User Accounts > Add or Edit > Add or Edit User Account > VPN Policy > SSL VPN Client
choices.A: Configuration > Remote Access VPN > Network (Client) Access > Group Policies > Add or Edit > Add or Edit Internal Group Policy
choices.D: Configuration > Remote Access VPN > Network (Client) Access > Group Policies > Add or Edit
choices.B: Configuration > Remote Access VPN > Network (Client) Access > AAA Setup > Local Users > Add or Edit

questions.question_text: In the Cisco ASDM interface, where do you enable the DTLS protocol setting?

discussion.content: "Configuration > Remote Access VPN > Network (Client) Access > Group Policies > Add or Edit > Advanced > Anyconnect" would be correct

It's C as the explanation shows. 
Option D is incomplete.

questions.answer_description:
Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa98/asdm78/vpn/asdm-78-vpn-config/vpn-asdm-setup.html
Shows where DTLS can be configured as:
Configuration > Remote Access VPN > Network (Client) Access > Group Policies > Add or Edit > Add or Edit Internal Group Policy > Advanced > SSL VPN

Client -
Configuration > Remote Access VPN > Network (Client) Access > AAA Setup > Local Users > Add or Edit > Add or Edit User Account > VPN Policy > SSL VPN

Client -
Device Management > Users/AAA > User Accounts > Add or Edit > Add or Edit User Account > VPN Policy > SSL VPN Client

choices.B: The Cisco ASA appliance must have connectivity to the TFTP server where the Cisco ASA image is stored through the Management 0/0 interface.
choices.A: Access to the ROM monitor mode is required.
choices.C: The copy tftp flash command is necessary to start the TFTP file transfer.
choices.E: Cisco ASA password recovery must be enabled
choices.D: The server command is necessary to set the TFTP server IP address.

questions.question_text:
The Cisco ASA software image has been erased from flash memory. Which two statements about the process to recover the Cisco ASA software image are true?
(Choose two.)

Which Cisco ASA SSL VPN feature provides support for PCI compliance by allowing for the validation of two sets of username and password credentials on the
SSL VPN login page?

discussion.content:
With ASA version 8.2, the SSL VPN remote access (Clientless and AnyConnect) supports secondary/double authentication. For example you can have RSA/OTP+LDAP authentication, or certificates+RSA/OTP+LDAP,etc.

https://community.cisco.com/t5/security-knowledge-base/anyconnect-vpn-client-faq/ta-p/3117980/page/2
